repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.unittitle: Russian Slavic Central Asian Student Association Records
did.abstract: This collection contains event ideas and fliers, budgets, the constitution, logo, and club fair presentation created by the Russian Slavic Central Asian Student Association (RSCA).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Ashley Aron, 2021, accession number MS-2021-030.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in one series, 2021 accessions.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Russian Circle was established in the early to mid-1990s and renamed the Russian Slavic Students Association (RSSA) in approximately 2014. In 2020, RSSA was renamed the Russian Slavic Central Asian Student Association (RSCA). Its mission is to provide students with opportunities to become more familiar with Russian culture, language, history, society, and politics. The RSCA is the only Slavic/Soviet/post-Soviet cultural group at Tufts and is endorsed by the Russian Language and Cultural Studies Program through the Department of International Literary and Cultural Studies.

The Russian Slavic Central Asian Student Association's events and meetings are located in the Russian House on 101 Talbot Ave. The Russian House houses eight undergraduate students in their second to fourth year.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Russian Slavic Central Asian Student Association Records, 2019 -- 2021. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains event ideas and fliers, budgets, the constitution, logo, and club fair presentation created by the Russian Slavic Central Asian Student Association (RSCA).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Any intellectual property rights that the donor possesses have been transferred to Tufts University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist Jane Kelly in March 2021. Materials were bagged using Bagger and ingested to the Tufts Digital Library. Files were arranged chronologically, and series and collection-level description was created at the time of processing.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Ashley Aron, 2021, accession MS-2021-030.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist Jane Kelly in March 2021. Materials were bagged using Bagger and ingested into the Tufts Digital Library. Files were arranged chronologically, and series and collection-level description was created at the time of processing. Digital files in this series were transferred to Box and their original creation date was no longer retrievable. Circa dates have been assigned to items based on the content in the files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains event ideas and fliers, budgets, the constitution, logo, and club fair presentation created by the Russian Slavic Central Asian Student Association (RSCA).
